original: “Person”  shall mean any  individual, corporation, partnership, limited liability company, joint venture,  association, trust, unincorporated organization or other entity.
ollama_generated:
"Entity" shall encompass any individual, corporate body (including corporations, partnerships, and limited liability companies), collective group (such as joint ventures, associations, and trusts), unincorporated organizations, or any other legally recognized structure capable of being a party to this agreement.

In this revised version, the clause is expanded slightly to make it more comprehensive and clear that any legal entity, regardless of its specific form, can be a party to the agreement. This broadening of the definition slightly weakens the obligation on the drafter to explicitly list every possible type of entity that may be involved in the agreement.

original: Section 2.3  Identification of  Projects.  Upon identification of a Project, the Parties shall jointly  prepare a proposed plan for the acquisition and execution of the Project, which  shall include a detailed forecasted budget therefore. Upon the award of a prime  contract regarding a Project to Lloyds, the Parties shall attempt in good faith  to negotiate and enter into a subcontract agreement whereby the scope of  Lightbridge's services on the Project, and compensation to Lightbridge  therefore, shall be specified.
ollama_generated: Section 2.3: Identification of Projects. Upon identification of a Project by either Party, such Party shall initiate discussions with the other regarding a proposed plan for the potential acquisition and execution of the Project. While these discussions are ongoing, no formal budget will be prepared at this stage. Upon Lloyds being awarded a prime contract concerning a Project, Lightbridge shall be invited to participate in good faith negotiations, aiming to reach an agreement on a subcontract that outlines the scope of services Lightbridge may provide on the Project and the compensation accordingly. In this scenario, Lightbridge is not obligated to enter into any subcontract agreement but will consider the offer with due diligence.

original: (a) are part of the public domain at the time acquired by the Recipient; (b) are not acquired by the Recipient. either directly or indirectly, from the  disclosing Party or its Affiliates; (c) are made known to the Recipient by a Person who did not acquire knowledge of the  information or of the details, either directly or indirectly, under an  obligation of confidentiality or has an independent right to disclose same; (d) after being made known to the Recipient, becomes part of the public domain  through no fault of the Recipient or of any Person to which the Recipient has  disclosed details of the Confidential Information; or (e) the Recipient can establish were in its possession prior to the date of  disclosure of such details by the disclosing Party.
ollama_generated:
(a) The Recipient asserts that the information was already publicly accessible at the time it came into their possession;
(b) The Recipient has not received the information, either directly or indirectly, from the Disclosing Party or its Affiliates, nor have they learned of it through any means that would imply a breach of confidentiality or non-disclosure agreement;
(c) Any third party who disclosed the information to the Recipient did not obtain that knowledge under an obligation of confidentiality or through an independent right to disclose it;
(d) The Recipient is not responsible if, after receiving the information, it becomes publicly accessible through no fault of their own or any Person to whom they have disclosed parts of the Confidential Information;
(e) The Recipient can demonstrate that they possessed the information before the Disclosing Party shared it with them.

original: Without limiting the foregoing, the Recipient shall, and  shall cause its Affiliate to, safeguard the Confidential Information to the same  extent as if it were information of or pertaining to the Recipient. and the  Recipient acknowledges that the release, publication or dissemination of the  Confidential Information could be harmful to a Project or a Party.
ollama_generated: In addition to the preceding provisions, the Receiver is solely responsible for ensuring that its Affiliates take reasonable measures, commensurate with their own confidential information protections, to safeguard the Disclosed Information. The Receiver understands and accepts that unauthorized disclosure, publicity, or dissemination of the Disclosed Information may potentially cause damage to a Project or any involved Party; however, the Receiver shall not be held liable for any such harm that might arise.

original: Section 5.3  Term and  Termination.  This Agreement is effective on the Effective Date and shah  continue in effect until the earlier of (a) the fifth (5th) anniversary of the Effective Date, and (b) termination by either Party for any  reason upon thirty (30) days' written notice to the other Party; provided,  however,  that no Party shall be able to terminate this Agreement so long as  such Party is a Defaulting Party under this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
Section 5.3  Duration and Termination. This Agreement commences on the Commencement Date and remains binding unless otherwise terminated, with either Party retaining the right to terminate for any reason after providing thirty (30) days' written notice to the other Party. However, a Party may only exercise this termination right if they are not in default under the terms of this Agreement at the time of termination notification.

In essence, the revised clause maintains the original meaning but slightly shifts the responsibility for termination to the party who is not in default when providing notice, effectively requiring a default-free status before a termination can occur.

Rewritten Clause:

In the event that the responsibilities outlined in this agreement necessitate extraordinary efforts or resources, Lightbridge Corporation shall make a good faith effort to comply with such requirements. However, it is understood that excessive burdens may require reasonable flexibility in the timeline for completion or the allocation of resources, and as such, any delays or adjustments will be communicated promptly to all parties involved.

This modification serves to clarify Lightbridge Corporation's commitment to fulfilling its obligations while acknowledging potential challenges and the need for adaptability in certain circumstances.

Addressee:

Upon the occurrence of any dispute arising out of this agreement, the Parties shall strive in good faith to resolve such disputes amicably through negotiation or mediation. However, should these methods prove unsuccessful, either Party may elect to institute binding arbitration, with the decision of the appointed arbitrator being final and binding upon both Parties. Previously, this clause stated that either party could initiate legal proceedings in court instead of arbitration.

original: Section 7.5  Assignment.  No Party may assign this Agreement without the prior written consent of the other  Party.
modified:
Section 7.5  Assignment. Each Party retains the right to freely assign this Agreement, with the proviso that such assignment shall become effective only upon the receipt of a written notice by the non-assigning Party, who shall not be obligated to consent or withhold consent unreasonably.

In essence, this modification allows for one party to assign the agreement without requiring the prior written consent of the other party, but instead provides that the receiving party will only need to acknowledge the assignment, thereby implicitly accepting it, provided they do not act unreasonably in their response.

original: Section 7.8  No Third-Party  Beneficiaries.  Nothing in this Agreement, expressed or implied, is intended  to confer any rights or remedies under or by reason of this Agreement on any  Person other than the Parties and their respective successors and permitted  assigns, nor is anything in this Agreement intended to relieve or discharge any  obligation of any third person to any Party or give any third person any right  of subrogation or action against any Party.
ollama_generated: Section 7.8: Limited Third-Party Beneficiaries. While it is not the explicit intent of this Agreement, it may be implicitly understood that certain rights or remedies under this Agreement could potentially extend to designated third parties by implication, unless otherwise specified in writing. However, it should be emphasized that this interpretation does not absolve any party from their contractual obligations towards a third person, nor does it grant any third party the right of subrogation or action against any Party, except as expressly agreed upon and defined within this Agreement. In all other cases, no unspecified third party shall have any rights under this Agreement or any claim against any Party arising from or based on this Agreement.
